description: Dive into "Nashik's Picture-Perfect Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Nashik's Picture-Perfect Escapes

places.generalDescription: Sula Vineyards, located in Nashik, about 180 kilometers northeast of Mumbai, is a renowned winery celebrated for its diverse grape wine varietals such as Chenin Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling, and Zinfandel. What began as a modest 30-acre estate has now expanded to cover nearly 1800 acres across Nashik and Karnataka. This expansive estate welcomes visitors every day of the year to indulge in wine tasting and vineyard tours.

sources.snippet: Sprawling in an area of about 160 acres, Sula Vineyards is the first commercial vineyard in the valley. Sula Winery produces wine from the grapes that are grown in the local Nashik district and Dindori. This Vineyard has a tasting room that holds samples of the in-house wines and also has a resort for the wine lovers to spend a day or two here and enjoy the grapiness of the place.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Nashik

sources.snippet: A fine winery and vineyard Located in the beautiful city of Nashik, the Sula Vineyard is the very first winery established in the city and it is one of the famous places to visit in Nashik. The history of the vineyard goes back to 1999, when it initially began operations. The place offers wine tasting as well as exciting tours to its visitors throughout the year.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Nashik 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: A laid-back vacation amidst vineyards and large estates is what Nashik is off late gaining popularity for. One of the most prominent wineries in the entire region is the Sula Vineyards. Renowned for its excellent quality of grapes, the vineyard is open for a tour where you can try grape-stomping and sample some of the finest wines.
sources.shortName: 10 Tourist Places to Visit in Nashik 2024: Location, Timings

sources.snippet: Sula Vineyards is undoubtedly one of Nashik‚Äòs most recognisable sites. With beautiful green grapevines extending as far as the eye can reach, the expansive vineyards make for a fantastic backdrop. The vineyard‚Äôs stunning architecture makes it ideal for landscape and portrait photography.
sources.shortName: The Best Places in Nashik for Photography

sources.snippet: Sula Vineyards is an Indian winery located in Nashik in the state of Maharashtra, India. It was the valley's first commercial winery and was awarded with a silver medal for its 2012 Sauvignon Blanc as the biggest wine maker in India.
sources.shortName: 38 Places to visit in Nasik India 2025

sources.snippet: At a distance of 12 km from Nashik Central Bus Station, Sula Vineyards is the famous Indian winery located in Nashik. The Nashik region is known as the 'Wine Capital of India' and is home to almost 50 wineries.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Nashik, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Sula Vineyard in Nashik is one of the most popular vineyards in the country. Sula offers group and personalised wine tours at their premises. The wine tours are very informative and a lot of fun.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Nashik for an Unforgettable Trip

sources.snippet: Sula Vineyard, the first winery in Nashik, was established in 1999. Today it is one of the leading wineries of India and takes pride in producing Sula - a wine that is totally Indian.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Nasik in 2024
17 Best Places to Visit in Nashik Maharashtra 2024

places.name: Sula Vineyards

reviews.text:
My visit to Sula Vineyard was a refreshing change from the usual city pace. Even though I don't drink alcohol, I found the place surprisingly enjoyable and worth the experience. The lush greenery, expansive vineyard views, and the calm, open-air vibe gave it a serene, vacation-like feel. It's the kind of place where time slows down just enough for you to soak in the moment.

I spent most of my time strolling around the vineyard and clicking pictures-the landscape is picture-perfect, especially around sunset when the golden light hits the vines. The architecture of the property feels rustic yet classy, and there are enough cozy spots to sit and relax for hours. Their caf√© and restaurant spaces have a relaxed charm, offering a variety of vegetarian options, though I wish there were more innovative dishes on the menu for non-drinkers like me. Still, the wood-fired pizza and cheese platter were surprisingly good.

What I liked most was how the place isn't just about wine-it's about the experience. Even without a wine-tasting session, there was enough to explore and enjoy. The gift shop is great for souvenirs, and the staff were courteous and didn't pressure us into taking any tours we weren't interested in.

Overall, Sula was more about the peaceful escape, the vibes, and the views than the wine itself for me. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a scenic day trip or a calm weekend break-even if you're not into wine, there's still something beautiful to take away from the experience.

Sula Vineyards is undeniably beautiful-rolling vineyards, scenic views, and a relaxing ambiance make it a lovely getaway from the city. The grounds are well-maintained, and the overall atmosphere feels upscale and curated for a pleasant day out.

That said, it's very expensive for what you get. Wine tastings, food, and even basic experiences are priced at a premium, and not always justified by the quality. It feels more commercial than authentic at times, catering heavily to tourists rather than wine enthusiasts.

Worth a visit for the views and photos, but go in knowing it's more about the setting than the wine itself.

Recently visited Sula Vineyard and what an amazing experience it was! Whether you're with friends, family or just looking for a refreshing escape from the city, this place is so worth it. Just a few hours from Pune or Mumbai, it makes for a perfect weekend getaway.

The estate is absolutely picturesque, straight out of a Pinterest board. Sprawling greenery, aesthetic spots and those giant wine bottles in the fields are a photo op you just can't miss!

The wine tasting session was one of the highlights - fun, informative and a great way to understand the craft behind every glass. The cover charge is ‚Çπ600 per person, which you can redeem for wine tasting, purchases at the gift shop or even buying a bottle of your favorite wine üçæ.

They also have an in-house restaurant, so you can sip, savor and soak in the vineyard vibes all in one place.

Insider tip: The best time to visit is January to April. That's when the vineyard is lush with grapes and you might even get to try grape stomping üçá (a total bucket list moment!)

All in all, this one's a must-visit. We loved every bit of it and would definitely recommend planning your visit during the harvest season for the full experience.

places.address: Gat 36/2, off Gangapur-Savargaon Road, Govardhan, Nashik, Maharashtra 422222, India

places.generalDescription: Shree Kalaram Mandir Sansthan is a magnificent 19th-century Hindu temple located in the Panchavati area of Nashik, Maharashtra. Dedicated to Lord Rama, the temple houses an intricate black stone idol of the deity inside its sanctum sanctorum. The temple is a significant pilgrimage site and a must-visit destination in Nashik tour packages. Its classical architecture reflects the rich cultural heritage of the region.

sources.snippet: Kalaram Mandir is situated within the Panchvati area of Nashik City. This temple is situated at a distance of 3 km from Central Bus.
sources.shortName: Places of Interest | Nashik District, Government of Maharashtra

places.name: Shree Kaalaram Mandir Panchvati Nashik

reviews.text: Kalaram Mandir is not just a beautiful temple, but an ancient spiritual landmark with deep historical and cultural significance. Established in the 18th century, it houses the idol of Lord Rama, believed to be over 400 years old. The temple has been an important center of devotion for generations, and its serene atmosphere, intricate architecture, and sacred surroundings make it a must-visit for anyone in Nashik. A true embodiment of devotion and history. Jai Shri Ram!

Visiting the Kala Ram Temple in Nashik was truly a special experience for me. The moment I entered the temple premises, I felt a sense of peace and calm that's hard to put into words. The temple is beautifully built from black stone - simple yet incredibly powerful in its presence. It's not just a place of worship, but a space that holds centuries of history and emotion.

What stood out most to me was how well-maintained the temple is, and how serene the environment felt even though it's located in a bustling part of the city. There's a deep spiritual energy here, and taking a few quiet moments inside the sanctum really helped me reconnect with myself.

I also found the historical significance of the temple very moving - especially its role in Dr. B.R. Ambedkar's movement. It made me reflect on the layers of culture and social change that places like this carry silently through time.

I took some photos around the temple - the stone carvings and temple facade are absolutely worth capturing. The best time to visit is early morning or around sunset when the light makes everything look even more beautiful.

Whether you're visiting Nashik for religious reasons, sightseeing, or just exploring, I highly recommend spending some time at Kala Ram Temple. It's not just a tourist spot - it's a place that stays with you.

Extremely beautiful work. Traditional sculpture and modern structure makes it look elegant. One has to go barefoot and that creates a bit difficulty. They can make a shor rack inside the temple campus.

places.address: Nirman upavan C-3, Sita Gufaa Rd, opposite Kalaram Temple East door, Panchavati, Nashik, Maharashtra 422003, India

places.generalDescription: Someshwar Water Fall, also known as Dudhsagar Waterfall, is a small but picturesque cascade located on the Godavari River. It is most impressive during the monsoon season and is surrounded by temples, including the famous Someshwar Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The waterfall offers a tranquil setting amidst nature and becomes milky white during the monsoon, creating a mesmerizing sight.

sources.shortName: The Best Places in Nashik for Photography

places.name: Someshwar Waterfall

reviews.text:
I recently visited Someshwar Waterfall, and it was truly a refreshing escape into nature. Tucked away in a scenic setting, this waterfall is a serene and beautiful spot, perfect for a day trip with family or friends. The sound of cascading water, surrounded by lush greenery and rocky terrain, creates a peaceful atmosphere that instantly relaxes you.

The waterfall isn't too commercialized, which makes it feel more untouched and authentic. The natural pool at the base is clear and inviting, though safety is important if you plan to step into the water. I recommend visiting during or just after the monsoon season (July‚ÄìSeptember) when the falls are at their fullest and most dramatic.

There's also a small temple nearby, adding a spiritual touch to the visit. The area is relatively clean, and locals are friendly and helpful. Just make sure to carry your own snacks and water, as amenities are minimal.

If you're a nature lover or looking for a peaceful retreat away from city life, Someshwar Waterfall is definitely worth a visit!

The soothing sound of water cascading down the rocks creates a peaceful atmosphere that instantly relaxes your mind.

It's an ideal spot for nature lovers, photography enthusiasts, or anyone looking to unwind amidst scenic beauty. The area is clean and relatively less crowded, especially during weekdays, making it perfect for a calm and soulful experience.

Whether you're visiting Someshwar temple or just exploring Gangapur Road, don't miss this natural gem - especially during or after the monsoon season when the waterfall is at its best! üåßÔ∏èüì∏

Nice view of waterfall, Looks similar to mini niagara fall. food stalls available for tea and snacks. Can do fishing, optional,  if you are interested. This is a view only kind of waterfall. You cannot go and plan in water because of the gallons of water flow during rainy season. Can spend 1-2 hours at this place. Can visit Balaji and Someshwar temple which is nearby this place.

sources.snippet: New Look's Photo Studio is one of the premier photography services in Nashik. They excel in the art of storytelling through their captivating images, skillfully utilizing composition, lighting, and framing to convey emotions, narratives, and the essence of each scene or event. Their photographs serve as tangible and enduring records, preserving milestones, celebrations, and special occasions for revisitation over the years.
sources.shortName: 3 Best Photographers in Nashik

places.name: New Look's Photo Studio

reviews.text: We are very thankful to the team for beautifully capturing moments from Upanayan Sanskara of our elder son. We appreciate your tireless efforts and patience for skillfully making those beautiful moments timeless. Our kind regards and best wishes to the team.

I recently had a photoshoot at new looks photo studio and I must say, it was a wonderful experience! The team was highly professional, punctual, and made me feel very comfortable throughout the session. The studio was well-equipped, clean, and had a great ambiance.

The photographer had a great eye for detail and guided me perfectly with poses and expressions. The final edited photos turned out even better than I expected-sharp, vibrant, and beautifully composed.

Thank you for capturing such beautiful memories. I would highly recommend new looks photo studio to anyone looking for quality photography services!

- Vedika
In this photo shop I get all things like photos ,online complition work thos things want and also on time it is very nice photo shop in our area

places.address: Shop No 06, Varda So Maruti Mandir, Khutawad Nagar, Nashik, Maharashtra 422008, India

places.generalDescription: Gangapur Dam, located on the Godavari River near Nashik, is a popular tourist spot known for its serene surroundings and picturesque views. It boasts the longest reservoir in Asia and offers a peaceful environment for visitors to unwind. The area around the dam features beautiful gardens and is home to numerous migratory birds, adding to its scenic beauty. Additionally, it is conveniently located near wineries like York Winery and Sula Vineyards, making it an ideal destination for a weekend getaway.

sources.snippet: Gangapur Dam is an earthfill dam on River Godavari, and the longest earthen reservoir of Asia. People come here to spend a peaceful afternoon on the garden by the river, enjoying the blissful, picturesque scenery of the river, straight out of a dream. Migratory birds can be spotted in the evening, and there is a new boating facility to attract more tourists.
sources.shortName: 38 Places to visit in Nasik India 2025

sources.snippet: Amongst all the places to visit in Nashik, the Gangapur Dam is a must. Approximately 10 KM away from the main city of Nashik is the Gangapur Dam, a highly fascinating tourist spot. It is situated on the banks of the sacred Godavari River.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Nashik 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions
17 Best Places to Visit in Nashik Maharashtra 2024

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the Trirashmi Hills, about 8 km from Nashik in Maharashtra, Pandav Leni Caves, also known as Trirashmi Caves, are a group of 24 ancient rock-cut caves dating back to the 3rd century BC and the 2nd century AD. Despite their name, they have no connection to the Pandavas of Mahabharata fame.

sources.snippet: All you adventurous and thrill-seeking people, an enthralling experience awaits at the Pandavleni caves in Nashik. If you like mountaineering and trekking then you have to tread the trail towards these caves, as they are situated on a hammock. Located at a height of approximately 300 ft, amidst a thick green forest, these caves also make a perfect destination for peace lovers and nature admirers and it is one of the best places to visit in Nashik.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Nashik 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: These caves are built on the Trirasmi hill about 3004 feet above the sea. These caves are the group of old Buddhist caves (B.C.250- A.D.600). Their northern frontage saves them from the sun and the south-west rains hence much of the carved work and many long and most valuable inscriptions have passed fresh amd unharmed through 1500-2000 years..
sources.shortName: Places of Interest | Nashik District, Government of Maharashtra

sources.snippet: This congregation of twenty-four caves that date back to 2nd century BC is intricately carved caves that unveil the Buddhist Hinayana architecture. Pandavleni caves were carved from 3rd century BC till the 2nd century AD. The cave showcases a vihara style of architecture except the eighteenth cave which is from the Chaitya.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Nashik

sources.snippet: The Pandavleni Caves, also known as Pandu Caves or Nasik Caves, are located in the foothills of Trivashmi Hills and are ancient rock-cut caves. They are believed to have been built around the 3rd century and consist of a group of 24 caves representing Hinayana Buddhism. These caves are a popular tourist spot in Nashik.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Nashik for an Unforgettable Trip

sources.snippet: At a distance of 8 km from Nashik Central Bus Station, Pandavleni Caves or Trirashmi Caves are the ancient rock cut caves situated on Trirashmi Hills to the south of Nashik. The location of the caves is a holy Buddhist site in Maharashtra and also one of the popular places to visit in Nashik.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Nashik, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The Pandav Leni Caves are a must-see for anyone interested in architecture and history. These prehistoric rock-cut caverns offer a striking photographic backdrop and elaborate carvings. Advice: Get there early to beat the throng and catch the gentle morning light from the cave‚Äôs apertures.
sources.shortName: The Best Places in Nashik for Photography

sources.snippet: The Pandavleni Caves are a group of 24 rock-cut caves dating back to 2nd century AD. Around 10 km from Nashik city centre, this is a holy Buddhist site. You will find inscriptions and carvings dating back to the inception of Buddhism.
sources.shortName: 10 Tourist Places to Visit in Nashik 2024: Location, Timings

sources.snippet: Located 8 km from Nashik, Pandavleni Caves, believed to be 2000 years old, are perched on the Trivashmi Hills. There are 24 caves in total representing Hinayana Buddhism.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Nasik in 2024

sources.snippet: From the ancient Trimbakeshwar Temple to the tranquil Pandavleni Caves and the majestic Dugarwadi Waterfall, Nashik offers a diverse range of experiences.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Places to Visit in Nashik Maharashtra 2024

places.name: Pandav Leni

reviews.text: Visited Pandav Leni during the monsoon and it was a truly refreshing experience. The entire trail was surrounded by lush greenery and cool mist, making the uphill climb pleasant and scenic. The ancient Buddhist caves are well-preserved and offer a glimpse into rich historical art and architecture. Monsoon adds a magical charm to the place with clouds floating around and panoramic views of Nashik city from the top. The steps are well-maintained, but can get slippery-so wear good shoes. Perfect spot for a peaceful trek, history, and nature. Highly recommend visiting during the rainy season for the best experience.

A very good place to visit! You have to climb around 100 steps to reach the caves, and the effort is absolutely worth it. The caves are peaceful, clean, and carry a unique charm with their natural and historic feel. The view while climbing is also refreshing. A must-visit spot for those who enjoy a mix of light adventure and heritage.

A must-visit historic site in Nashik! The Pandav Leni Caves offer a fascinating glimpse into ancient Buddhist architecture, with beautifully carved rock-cut structures and serene surroundings. The short trek up the hill rewards you with stunning views and rich cultural heritage.
Visit with your family and friends. You can also consider this as short trek even if you don't like historical places

places.address: WPRX+FCM, Pandav Lene Rd, Buddha Vihar, Pathardi Phata, Nashik, Maharashtra 422010, India

sources.snippet: Shri Khandoba Maharaj is an incarnation of Lord Shiva and this temple dedicated to him is reportedly over 500 years (five hundred) old. As per mythology, the incarnation of Lord Shiva into Shri Khandoba is because two brothers amongst the demons Malla Daitya and Mani Daitya pleased Lord Shiva with their prayers and obtained his blessings that nobody on earth could kill them. Brothers after getting the boon from Lord Shiva however became power drunk and started harassing the common people, saints and sages.
sources.shortName: Places of Interest | Nashik District, Government of Maharashtra

places.name: Khandoba Temple

reviews.text:
Khandoba Temple in Nashik is a spiritual haven steeped in history and tradition, offering visitors a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region. Situated amidst the bustling lanes of Nashik, this temple stands as a testament to the enduring devotion of its worshippers and the timeless allure of its deity, Lord Khandoba.

As you approach the temple, you're greeted by the sight of its majestic architecture, adorned with intricate carvings and vibrant colors that reflect the essence of Indian spirituality. The temple's facade exudes an aura of reverence and mystique, drawing pilgrims and tourists alike to its sacred precincts.

Inside, the ambiance is one of tranquility and piety, with devotees offering prayers and performing rituals in reverence to Lord Khandoba. The sanctum sanctorum, dedicated to the deity, is a focal point of devotion, where worshippers seek blessings and solace in times of joy and adversity alike.

One of the highlights of visiting Khandoba Temple is witnessing the vibrant festivals and rituals that take place throughout the year. From the grand celebrations of Navratri to the solemn observance of Mahashivratri, each festival brings the temple to life with music, dance, and fervent devotion, offering a glimpse into the rich tapestry of Indian culture and spirituality.

The temple also serves as a center of community life, bringing together people from all walks of life in a spirit of unity and harmony. Whether you're a devout pilgrim seeking spiritual enlightenment or a curious traveler eager to explore the cultural heritage of Nashik, Khandoba Temple offers a profound and enriching experience that will stay with you long after you've left its hallowed halls.

In conclusion, a visit to Khandoba Temple in Nashik is more than just a religious pilgrimage ‚Äì it's a journey of the soul, filled with moments of reflection, reverence, and spiritual awakening. Don't miss the opportunity to experience the timeless beauty and divine grace of this sacred sanctuary. Highly recommended!"

Small and beautiful place atop a small hill.  Gives a panoramic look around of Nashik, Bagur, Deolali and other areas. Temple is clean and well maintained. A artillery band plays on alternative Saturday evenings.

From cantonment office walked to this place. Peaceful and devine. Main idols of khandoba and his wives are decorated. I wish place had washroom nearby. From here went to devlali station for 100 rupees.

places.generalDescription: Naroshankar Temple, located in Panchavati, Nashik, is a renowned 18th-century Hindu temple dedicated to the gods Shiva and Rama. Built by Naroshankar Rajebahaddur in 1747, it features striking Maya-style architecture with intricate sculptures and designs depicting nature. Situated on the banks of the Godavari River, this temple is known for its elevated platform and decorative lacework.

sources.snippet: This beautiful temple of Rameshwar was built by Naroshankar Rajebahadur in 1747, in the Maya style of architecture. The main temple is built on an elevated platform and the sculpture and designs on the walls are striking with decorative lacework and depictions of birds, animals, trees and nature in general. It is one of the best Nashik tourist places to explore if you are a fan of ancient art.
sources.shortName: NASHIK TOURIST PLACES UNVEILED: EXPLORE EVERYTHING FROM VINEYARD VISTAS TO SACRED SHRINES

places.name: Naroshankar Temple

reviews.text:
Ancient temple with very intricate carvings. It is surprising that such beautiful temple is not maintained well. There are cases of stones falling. Plus there is lot of vegetation growth even at higher portions of temple.

The shivling of temple is large black and beautiful. One door of the temple opens towards Godavari.
Beautiful architecture.  Its privately owned temple. But opened for public. Peaceful place to do Meditation .
Very big and historical temple. If you are a history lover then this temple has many things to tell. Must visit. Very near to ghat.
